chapter.title: Recommended update order for environments with more than one UCS server

section.title: Removed/unspported Components
section.para: Some components have been removed and are not shipped any longer with UCS 4.0:

listitem.para: The Xen hypervisor has been removed and is no longer supported by UCS. Details on migrating to QEMU/KVM is provided in .
The Scalix LDAP schema has been removed in UCS 4.0. It is required to remove all Scalix related attributes from LDAP prior to the update.

section.title: Network connection for virtual machines
section.para: Newly installed host servers using QEMU/KVM no longer automatically create a bridge network interface by default. This must be setup manually. Further information can be found in Chapter 8 of the UCS manual UCS-Handbuch and in ext-doc-uvmm.

section.title: Windows NT DC functionality is deprecated with UCS 4.0
section.para: The Windows NT domain services provided classically by Samba 3 have been superceeded by the Windows AD domain services provided by Samba 4. It is recommended to choose Windows AD domain services for the setup of new UCS domains.

section.title: Optional ppolicy LDAP overlay requires all DCs to be UCS 4.0
section.para: On domain controllers using the MDB LDAP backend (e.g. systems installed with UCS 4.0) the ppolicy LDAP overlay can now optionally be activated to implement account lockout in cases of repeated LDAP authentication failures. All domaincontrollers need to be updated to UCS 4.0 before activating this on any UCS domaincontroller. This is required to avoid replication issues.
